The exhibition, which will examine the legacy of American mass incarceration, will be organized as part of the institution’s ongoing work to dismantle the criminal justice system in the United States.The new gift will focus on the legacy of the late artist and activist Cornel West, whose work has been exhibited at the museum since 1994. West’s work will be presented by artist and activist Elissa Lissoni, who is known for her non-violent action and advocacy against mass incarceration, and will be organized by curator and curator Tina Schoonmaker. Art Basel Hong Kong announced today that it is planning to return the Hong Kong fairs’ Hangzhou and Shenzhen to China in 2021 as part of its pledge to invest $1.2 billion into the region’s arts and cultural sector over the next five years. The Hong Kong pavilion at the two editions of Art Basel Hong Kong will return to Beijing in 2021, and the Hong Kong fairs, “Hangzhou and Shenzhen,” will return to Hong Kong in 2022.Both fairs were shuttered last March due to the coronavirus and were only rescheduled for Hong Kong pavilion events in March and June.
